column4: yeah i am running extended self test but ubuntu is saying the drive is not smart enabled but it is and the overall health self-assessment test says passed
and gsmartcontrol started with not smart enabled but changed when it read the drive
i would give 10.10 at least 40 gig
i am not an expert either in fact i can't even install it it won't talk to my hdd
all other os's will and have no issue including ubuntu 9.1  and earlier but apparently everyone thinks it's my drive or one of the 6 ubuntu install cds or dvd's i have
not the fact that the developers messed up the installer
i can but it is not working for some reason a friend said the only usb stick i have is not bootable
it is not the cds
it is the installer
it won't talk to my drive
is it sata or ide?
sata
it could be the header
try plugging it into a different one
i can and recently did install a 9.4 installation and it went like clockwork
but not supported
and i can't upgrade to 10.10 from it
Why not?
well all installers except 10.04 and 10.10 will work all distro's i have tried
it is only ubuntu
is great if it will install
simple
why can't you upgrade from 9.04?
